description: 1728, un- +‎ remitting, from remit, from Latin [Term?], in now rare sense of “diminish, abate”. Not from (non-existent) *unremit.

adjectives.description: unremitting (comparative more unremitting, superlative most unremitting)

examples: We can achieve this god‐likeness only by unremitting and strenuous effort of the intellect.
